name: (2Z)-2-(1,3-Benzodioxol-5-ylmethylene)-6,7-dihydro-5H-[1,3]thiazolo[3,2-a]pyrimidin-3(2H)-one

The reference point is a basic heterocyclic compound such as pyrimidine with a melting point of 22°C. The presence of the benzodioxole aromatic group increases structural rigidity and allows for pi-pi stacking, resulting in an increase of about +80°C to the melting point. The conjugated double bond adjacent to the thiadiazine ring enhances rigidity and pi stacking, contributing an additional +30°C. The carbonyl group allows for hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by around +20°C. Lastly, the sulfur atom introduces additional electronic interactions and steric considerations, which could add approximately +10°C. The overall structure's rigidity and planarity promote solid-state packing efficiency, further raising the melting point.
